_documentation.format: Each race defines its requirements, modifiers, and abilities
_documentation.requirements: Minimum ability scores required to play this race
_documentation.modifiers: Ability score adjustments applied during character creation

races.name: Human
races.description: Humans come in a broad variety of shapes and sizes. An average Human male in good health stands around six feet tall and weighs about 175 pounds, while females average five feet nine inches and weigh around 145 pounds.
races.detailed_description: Humans come in a broad variety of shapes and sizes; the Game Master must decide what sorts of Humans live in the game world. An average Human male in good health stands around six feet tall and weighs about 175 pounds, while females average five feet nine inches and weigh around 145 pounds. Most Humans live around 75 years.

special_abilities.name: Fast Learning
special_abilities.description: Humans learn unusually quickly, gaining a bonus of 10% to all experience points earned

races.name: Dwarf
races.description: Dwarves are a short, stocky race; both male and female Dwarves stand around four feet tall and typically weigh around 120 pounds. Their long hair and thick beards are dark brown, gray or black.
races.detailed_description: Dwarves are a short, stocky race; both male and female Dwarves stand around four feet tall and typically weigh around 120 pounds. Their long hair and thick beards are dark brown, gray or black. They take great pride in their beards, sometimes braiding or forking them. They have a fair to ruddy complexion. Dwarves have stout frames and a strong, muscular build. They are rugged and resilient, with the capacity to endure great hardships. Dwarves are typically practical, stubborn and courageous. They can also be introspective, suspicious and possessive. They have a lifespan of three to four centuries.

special_abilities.name: Darkvision
special_abilities.description: All Dwarves have Darkvision with a 60' range

special_abilities.name: Stonework Detection
special_abilities.description: Able to detect slanting passages, stonework traps, shifting walls and new construction on a roll of 1-2 on 1d6; a search must be performed before this roll may be made

restrictions: Dwarves may become Clerics, Fighters, or Thieves
Due to their generally dour dispositions, they may not have a Charisma higher than 17
They may not employ Large weapons more than four feet in length (specifically, two-handed swords, polearms, and longbows)
races.saving_throws: Dwarves save at +4 vs. Death Ray or Poison, Magic Wands, Paralysis or Petrify, and Spells, and at +3 vs. Dragon Breath

races.name: Elf
races.description: Elves are a slender race, with both males and females standing around five feet tall and weighing around 130 pounds. Most have dark hair, with little or no body or facial hair.
races.detailed_description: Elves are a slender race, with both males and females standing around five feet tall and weighing around 130 pounds. Most have dark hair, with little or no body or facial hair. Their skin is pale, and they have pointed ears and delicate features. Elves are lithe and graceful. They have keen eyesight and hearing. Elves are typically inquisitive, passionate, self-assured, and sometimes haughty. Their typical lifespan is a dozen centuries or more.

special_abilities.name: Darkvision
special_abilities.description: All Elves have Darkvision with a 60' range

special_abilities.name: Secret Door Detection
special_abilities.description: They are able to find secret doors more often than normal (1-2 on 1d6 rather than the usual 1 on 1d6). An Elf is so observant that one has a 1 on 1d6 chance to find a secret door with a cursory look

special_abilities.name: Ghoul Immunity
special_abilities.description: Elves are immune to the paralyzing attack of ghouls

special_abilities.name: Surprise Resistance
special_abilities.description: They are less likely to be surprised in combat, reducing the chance of surprise by 1 in 1d6

special_abilities.name: Hit Die Limitation
special_abilities.description: Elves never roll larger than six-sided dice (d6) for hit points

restrictions: Elves may become Clerics, Fighters, Magic-Users or Thieves
They are also allowed to combine the classes of Fighter and Magic-User, and of Magic-User and Thief
Due to their generally delicate nature, they may not have a Constitution higher than 17
Elves never roll larger than six-sided dice (d6) for hit points
races.saving_throws: Elves save at +1 vs. Paralysis or Petrify, and +2 vs. Magic Wands and Spells

races.name: Halfling
races.description: Halflings are small, slightly stocky folk who stand around three feet tall and weigh about 60 pounds. They have curly brown hair on their heads and feet, but rarely have facial hair.
races.detailed_description: Halflings are small, slightly stocky folk who stand around three feet tall and weigh about 60 pounds. They have curly brown hair on their heads and feet, but rarely have facial hair. They are usually fair skinned, often with ruddy cheeks. Halflings are remarkably rugged for their small size. They are dexterous and nimble, capable of moving quietly and remaining very still. They usually go barefoot. Halflings are typically outgoing, unassuming and good-natured. They live about a hundred years.

special_abilities.name: Missile Accuracy
special_abilities.description: Halflings are unusually accurate with all sorts of ranged weapons, gaining a +1 attack bonus when employing them

special_abilities.name: Defensive Agility
special_abilities.description: When attacked in melee by creatures larger than man-sized, Halflings gain a +2 bonus to their Armor Class

special_abilities.name: Quick Reflexes
special_abilities.description: Halflings are quick-witted, adding +1 to Initiative die rolls

special_abilities.name: Hiding Ability
special_abilities.description: In their preferred forest terrain, they are able to hide very effectively; so long as they remain still there is only a 10% chance they will be detected. Even indoors, in dungeons or in non-preferred terrain they are able to hide such that there is only a 30% chance of detection. Note that a Halfling Thief will roll only once, using either the Thief ability or the Halfling ability, whichever is better

special_abilities.name: Hit Die Limitation
special_abilities.description: Halflings never roll larger than six-sided dice (d6) for hit points regardless of class

restrictions: Halflings may become Clerics, Fighters or Thieves
Due to their small stature, they may not have a Strength higher than 17
Halflings never roll larger than six-sided dice (d6) for hit points regardless of class
Halflings may not use Large weapons, and must wield Medium weapons with both hands
races.saving_throws: Halflings save at +4 vs. Death Ray or Poison, Magic Wands, Paralysis or Petrify, and Spells, and at +3 vs. Dragon Breath
